examples: She assumed indifference, even though she was seething with anger
The queen assumed the stately robes

results.definition: take on as one's own the expenses or debts of another person
seize and take control without authority and possibly with force; take as one's right or possession
examples: He assumed to himself the right to fill all positions in the town

results.definition: take on a certain form, attribute, or aspect
examples: The gods assume human or animal form in these fables

results.definition: take on titles, offices, duties, responsibilities
examples: When will the new President assume office?

results.definition: take to be the case or to be true; accept without verification or proof
examples: I assume his train was late

results.definition: take up someone's soul into heaven
examples: This is the day when Mary was assumed into heaven
